isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - INSTALL - INTEGRAL OIL PUMP

note.para: Lubricate the case front plug O-ring with Eaton/Fuller lubricant #71206 or equivalent.

step1.para: If removed, replace the front case plug O-ring and lubricate ( Figure 285).

figure.caption: Figure 285. Replace Front Case Plug O-Ring

step1.para: Use a maul to seat the front case plug in the case bore ( Figure 286).

figure.caption: Figure 286. Seat Front Case Plug in Case Bore

step1.para: With the retainer bore facing the case rear, install the integral oil pump retainer over the alignment pin inside the case ( Figure 287).

figure.caption: Figure 287. Install Integral Oil Pump Retainer

step1.para: Align the oil pump with the retainer and alignment pin and install the integral oil pump assembly ( Figure 288).

figure.caption: Figure 288. Install Integral Oil Pump Assembly

step1.para: Install three Allen head bolts and washers through the case front and into the pump housing. Tighten the bolts to 8 to 12 ft-lbs. (11 to 16 N·m) ( Figure 289).

figure.caption: Figure 289. Install Bolts and Washers Through Case Front

step1.para: Replace the O-ring on the suction tube.
Install the suction tube under the case rib and into the integral oil pump ( Figure 290).

figure.caption: Figure 290. Bend Suction Tube Lock Over Case Rib

step1.para: Bend the suction tube lock over the case rib ( Figure 290).
Position the oil tube in the case bottom through the intermediate wall ( Figure 291).

figure.caption: Figure 291. Position Oil Tube in Case Bottom

step1.para: Install the bolts to hold the oil tube in position. Tighten the bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m) ( Figure 291).

note.para: Make sure the integral oil pump drive gear can turn.
